paragraphs.text:
%md

# Get and Load Data

Obtain CSV file hero-network.csv from "Hero Social Network Data" in this website (Exposedata)

* http://syntagmatic.github.io/exposedata/marvel/

This data is a comma separated list of character pairs who are appearing together in the same chapter of the same comics.

    "IRON MAN/TONY STARK ","CHAIN"
    "IRON MAN/TONY STARK ","SPIDER-WOMAN II/JULI"
    "IRON MAN/TONY STARK ","CARPENTER, RACHEL"
    "CARPENTER, RACHEL","CHAIN"
    "CARPENTER, RACHEL","SPIDER-WOMAN II/JULI"
    ..

msg.data:
Get and Load Data

Obtain CSV file hero-network.csv from “Hero Social Network Data” in this website (Exposedata)

  • http://syntagmatic.github.io/exposedata/marvel/

This data is a comma separated list of character pairs who are appearing together in the same chapter of the same comics.

"IRON MAN/TONY STARK ","CHAIN"
"IRON MAN/TONY STARK ","SPIDER-WOMAN II/JULI"
"IRON MAN/TONY STARK ","CARPENTER, RACHEL"
"CARPENTER, RACHEL","CHAIN"
"CARPENTER, RACHEL","SPIDER-WOMAN II/JULI"
..

// Load the graph from the file to PGX
g = session.readGraphWithProperties(cfg)

paragraphs.text:
// Show the number of characters (nodes)
g.queryPgql(" SELECT ID(x) MATCH (x) ").getNumResults()

// Show the number of all co-appearances (edges)
g.queryPgql(" SELECT ID(e) MATCH (x)-[e]->(y) ").getNumResults()

// Pre-process the graph loaded.
g = g.undirect(
      MultiEdges.REMOVE_MULTI_EDGES  // Multi edges between the same nodes
    , SelfEdges.REMOVE_SELF_EDGES    // Edges between the same single node
    , Mode.CREATE_COPY               // Copy this graph
    , null                           // Graph name (optional)
    )

// Show the number of all co-appearances (edges)
g.queryPgql(" SELECT ID(e) MATCH (x)-[e]-(y) ").getNumResults()

%md
# Queries: Who are Co-appeared?
PGQL is convenient for pattern matching.
_Which characters have co-appeared with Ironman, Spiderman, and Wolverine, all of three heroes?_

msg.data:
Queries: Who are Co-appeared?

PGQL is convenient for pattern matching.
Which characters have co-appeared with Ironman, Spiderman, and Wolverine, all of three heroes?

paragraphs.text:
//
g.queryPgql("""
  SELECT ID(x)
  MATCH (x)-(a), (x)-(b), (x)-(c)
  WHERE ID(a)='IRON MAN/TONY STARK '
    AND ID(b)='SPIDER-MAN/PETER PAR'
    AND ID(c)='WOLVERINE/LOGAN '
""").print()

paragraphs.text:
// Set the query result into a variable first, and then count its number.
result = g.queryPgql("""
 SELECT ID(x)
  MATCH (x)-(a), (x)-(b), (x)-(c)
  WHERE ID(a)='IRON MAN/TONY STARK '
    AND ID(b)='SPIDER-MAN/PETER PAR'
    AND ID(c)='WOLVERINE/LOGAN '
""")
result.getNumResults()

%md
# Algorithms: Who are Important Heroes?

* Degree Centrality
    * Nodes with more edges are more important
    * _Impotant because of many friends?_
* Page Rank
    * If importance spread.. Nodes connected with important nodes are important?
    * _Friends of heroes are heroes?_
* Betweeness Centrality
    * Important if the node is in the shortest pathes between many pairs of other nodes.
    * _Everyone needs him/her!_

msg.data:
Algorithms: Who are Important Heroes?

  • Degree Centrality
    • Nodes with more edges are more important
    • Impotant because of many friends?
  • Page Rank
    • If importance spread.. Nodes connected with important nodes are important?
    • Friends of heroes are heroes?
  • Betweeness Centrality
    • Important if the node is in the shortest pathes between many pairs of other nodes.
    • Everyone needs him/her!

analyst.inDegreeCentrality(g)

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Query and Algorithm Together
PGX is convenient tool because we can refer results of graph algorithms (e.g. pagerank scores of nodes) in pattern matching using PGQL queries!
Let's modify the previous query as follows.
_Which characters have co-appeared with Ironman, Spiderman, and Wolverine, all of three heroes, but are "minor" = having low pagerank scores?_

msg.data:
Query and Algorithm Together

PGX is convenient tool because we can refer results of graph algorithms (e.g. pagerank scores of nodes) in pattern matching using PGQL queries!
Let’s modify the previous query as follows.
Which characters have co-appeared with Ironman, Spiderman, and Wolverine, all of three heroes, but are “minor” = having low pagerank scores?

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
result = g.queryPgql("""
 SELECT ID(x), x.pagerank
  MATCH (x)-(a), (x)-(b), (x)-(c)
  WHERE ID(a)='IRON MAN/TONY STARK '
    AND ID(b)='SPIDER-MAN/PETER PAR'
    AND ID(c)='WOLVERINE/LOGAN '
  ORDER BY x.pagerank ASC
""")
result.print(10)
